Miscellaneous Highlights: Danny Jansen will become the first ever MLB player to play for two teams in the same game.
Joey Loperfido has a chance to play in two games in two different cities on the same day.
Will Wagner and Leo Jimenez will have a chance to go back in time, re-recording big-league firsts.
The Blue Jays will immediately have to pinch-hit for Jansen.
Four of the position players in the lineup that day were traded at the deadline (Jansen, Isiah Kiner-Falefa, Justin Turner and Kevin Kiermaier).
Bo Bichette has since been placed on the injured list.
Jansen will enter as a defensive replacement.
The Blue Jays will make a pitching change, replacing Yariel Rodr√≠guez with Ryan Burr.
Loperfido already played once on June 26, going hitless in three at-bats for the Astros while facing the Rockies at Minute Maid Park.
Wagner and Jimenez, who both debuted in the majors after June 26, this could be like going back in time.
The Blue Jays could add veteran right-hander Paolo Espino as pitching depth in what may be a bullpen game.
The unusual nature of the suspended game leads to lots of questions, so the Blue Jays have been in touch with MLB officials.
